original:
The Theory of Endosymbiosis encompasses the study of lichens, which are complex organisms formed through the symbiotic relationship between fungi and photosynthetic partners, typically algae or cyanobacteria. Although the dual nature of lichens was initially regarded as a theory, significant advancements were made in 1939 when Swiss researcher Eugen A. Thomas successfully replicated the phenotype of the lichen
